DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 7 Last 2 Weeks Have Trouble Controlling Bladder Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their leaking urine /  poor bladder control, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Have Trouble Controlling Bladder Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about whether an individual has or had trouble controlling their bladder._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Have Trouble Controlling Bladder Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about whether an individual has or had trouble controlling their bladder.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about whether an individual has or had trouble controlling their bladder.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Bladder Control 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Require Clamp, Catheter, or Collecting Bag Because of Leaking Urine or Poor Bladder Control

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Require Clamp, Catheter, or Collecting Bag Because of Leaking Urine or Poor Bladder Control
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual requires a clamp, catheter, or collecting bag because of leaking urine or poor bladder control.

Concepts.longName: Require Clamp, Catheter, or Collecting Bag Because of Leaking Urine or Poor Bladder Control
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual requires a clamp, catheter, or collecting bag because of leaking urine or poor bladder control.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Never, Under Any Circumstances Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Never, Under Any Circumstances Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual never, under any circumstances leaks urine or loses bladder control.

Concepts.longName: Never, Under Any Circumstances Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual never, under any circumstances leaks urine or loses bladder control.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: On Rare Occasions, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Does not Interfere with Any Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: On Rare Occasions, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Does not Interfere with Any Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual, on rare occasions, leaks urine or loses bladder control but that it does not interfere with any activities.

Concepts.longName: On Rare Occasions, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Does not Interfere with Any Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual, on rare occasions, leaks urine or loses bladder control but that it does not interfere with any activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Occasionally Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Few Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Occasionally Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Few Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally leaks urine or loses bladder control and it interferes with a few activities.

Concepts.longName: Occasionally Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Few Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally leaks urine or loses bladder control and it interferes with a few activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate Amount of the Time, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Some Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate Amount of the Time, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Some Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual leaks urine or loses bladder control a moderate amount of the time and it interferes with some activities.

Concepts.longName: Moderate Amount of the Time, Leak Urine or Lose Bladder Control, Interferes with Some Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual leaks urine or loses bladder control a moderate amount of the time and it interferes with some activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Most of the Time, Leak Urine or Have Poor Bladder Control, Interferes with Many Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Most of the Time, Leak Urine or Have Poor Bladder Control, Interferes with Many Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual leaks urine or has poor bladder control most of the time and it interferes with many activities.

Concepts.longName: Most of the Time, Leak Urine or Have Poor Bladder Control, Interferes with Many Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual leaks urine or has poor bladder control most of the time and it interferes with many activities.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your leaking urine or poor bladder control in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
